page.title: 04LIMESTONE QUARRY
page.content: Less than a mile east of Creswell Colliery there is an outcrop of limestone which attracted the attentions of the Steetley Company who established a quarry here. The quarry face is drilled and filled with explosives which cause the limestone to fall to the floor of the quarry. It is loaded onto large lorries and carried the short distance to the works. Here it is crushed into different sizes before being used as road foundations and ballast. Some of the limestone is burnt to produce lime which can be used to make cement. Many local people are employed by the Steetley Company, but recently, as the quarry gets nearer to the limits of its development, some employees have been made redundant.
